paper.title: Provably Secure Distributed Schnorr Signatures and a (t, n) Threshold Scheme for Implicit Certificates
paper.venue: Australasian Conference on Information Security and Privacy
paper.abstract: In a (t, n) threshold digital signature scheme, t out of n signers must co-operate to issue a signature. We present an efficient and robust (t, n) threshold version of Schnorru0027s signature scheme. We prove it to be as secure as Schnorru0027s signature scheme, i.e., existentially unforgeable under adaptively chosen message attacks. The signature scheme is then incorporated into a (t, n) threshold scheme for implicit certificates. We prove the implicit certificate scheme to be as secure as the distributed Schnorr signature scheme.
